alert.note: Alert for Caroline (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 12:19PM EDT until July 16 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Delaware...and northeast Maryland...including the following counties...in Delaware...Kent and Sussex. In northeast Maryland...Caroline. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1216 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen through earlier this morning. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected this afternoon as heavy showers and thunderstorms redevelop over the advisory area. Locally high rainfall amounts are possible. Remain alert for possible warnings this afternoon. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Dover, Georgetown, Milford, Seaford, Laurel, Harrington, Federalsburg, Milton, Bridgeville, Ellendale, Bowers, and Viola. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
